scenes.title: Back on Earth, 2025
scenes.text:
After analyzing the data from Epsilon Station, you’re back on Earth. The observatory’s dome creaks as technicians adjust the sensors. The same mysterious signal pulses through your screens, faint but unmistakable.

The question: Could this be the start of a pattern that spans both space and time?

choices.label: Run a Fourier analysis on the signal
Check historical archives for similar patterns

scenes.title: Fourier Analysis
scenes.text: You feed the signal data into the analysis software. Peaks emerge at unexpected intervals. It seems the signal is composed of multiple periodic components.

puzzle.question: Identify the fundamental frequency given the peaks at 0.3 Hz, 0.9 Hz, and 1.5 Hz.
puzzle.explanation: The fundamental frequency is the smallest frequency that repeats across all observed peaks.

scenes.title: Historical Archives
scenes.text: You scan decades of archival signals. One pattern catches your eye: a repeating sequence every 13.2 seconds from observations 30 years ago. Could it be connected to Epsilon Station?

scenes.title: Pattern Confirmed
scenes.text: Your analysis confirms a fundamental frequency at 0.3 Hz. The alignment is too precise to be random. Something is intentionally encoded in the signal.

scenes.title: Analysis Inconclusive
scenes.text: You can’t determine the fundamental frequency clearly. Perhaps more data or a different approach is needed.

scenes.title: Supervisor Alert
scenes.text: Your supervisor frowns at the alert: 'This might be more serious than a simple anomaly. Let’s prioritize the analysis immediately.'

scenes.title: Preparing Deeper Analysis
scenes.text: You prepare to run a series of signal decompositions and simulations, hoping to uncover hidden patterns or messages.
